h1: How Many Calories in a Peanut Butter and Jelly Sandwich?
assumptions: 2 slices white bread (28 g each), 2 tbsp creamy peanut butter (32 g), 1 tbsp grape jelly (20 g); no added ingredients.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by bread type, peanut butter brand, jelly flavor, portion sizes, and preparation; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard PB&J sandwich has about 402 kcal, with 13 g protein and 50 g carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use whole wheat bread instead of white

faqs.q: How much calories in peanut butter and jelly sandwich?
faqs.a: Approximately 402 kcal for a standard version with 2 slices white bread, 2 tbsp PB, and 1 tbsp jelly.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a PB&J sandwich?
faqs.a: About 13 g, mostly from the peanut butter.

faqs.q: How many carbs in peanut butter and jelly sandwich?
faqs.a: Around 50 g total, including 20 g sugars from jelly and bread.

faqs.q: Does whole grain bread change calories in PB&J?
faqs.a: Yes, it can reduce calories by 20 kcal per sandwich while adding more fiber.

faqs.q: Why is sodium high in peanut butter and jelly sandwich?
faqs.a: From salted peanut butter and bread; opt for unsalted PB to lower it to under 200 mg.
